title: 11 Cozy, Luxe Sweaters to Upgrade Your Fall Wardrobe
description: Sweater season is one of our favorites of the entire year. While our closets are already well-stocked with chunky knits, there's never a bad time to add more styles to wear on repeat this season and well into the next. Fortunately, with so many cute sweaters for women that are already trending this year - with everything from sweater vests to cashmere pieces - there's truly no better time to start shopping. Whether you're looking for a cropped sweater to pair with high-waisted jeans or a cable-knit sweater to dress up with cargo pants, there's something about a cozy knit that's synonymous with the season - and ideal for styling with just about any outfit. In that spirit, we made a list of all the sweaters we wish we were actually wearing right now. So sit back, make yourself comfortable, and prepare to stock up on some seriously cozy sweaters ahead, with styles that range from a versatile sweater cardigan to a warm turtleneck. We included some of your favorite brands as well, with trendy Free People sweaters and even a handful of sweaters from Amazon that are affordable and chic. Ahead, browse our picks for the best sweaters for women to cozy up in this fall. Related: 10 Nordstrom Picks For Fall, From Shearling-Lined Clogs to a Sweater Vest
author: Kyley Warren
excerpt: Snuggle up with some coffee, and browse through our picks. ☕️
text: While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.Sweater season is one of our favorites of the entire year. While our closets are already well-stocked with chunky knits, there's never a bad time to add more styles to wear on repeat this season and well into the next. Fortunately, with so many cute sweaters for women that are already trending this year — with everything from sweater vests to cashmere pieces — there's truly no better time to start shopping. Whether you're looking for a cropped sweater to pair with high-waisted jeans or a cable-knit sweater to dress up with cargo pants, there's something about a cozy knit that's synonymous with the season — and ideal for styling with just about any outfit. In that spirit, we made a list of all the sweaters we wish we were actually wearing right now. So sit back, make yourself comfortable, and prepare to stock up on some seriously cozy sweaters ahead, with styles that range from a versatile sweater cardigan to a warm turtleneck. We included some of your favorite brands as well, with trendy Free People sweaters and even a handful of sweaters from Amazon that are affordable and chic. Ahead, browse our picks for the best sweaters for women to cozy up in this fall. lanebryant.comBest Tunic Sweater For WomenLane Bryant Cowlneck Stripe Tunic Sweater ($15, originally $80) You'll be so glad to have this warm and cozy tunic sweater tucked into your wardrobe come winter. Unlike other cropped styles, this piece has a longline tunic design that provides more coverage on the body. Plus, with its classic striped pattern, you'll have no problem teaming the knit with just about any item in your closet.oldnavy.gap.comBest Cardigan Sweater For WomenOld Navy Shaker-Stitch Cardigan ($27, originally $45) When it comes to quality sweaters that you can get extended use out of in a number of different seasons, we find that cardigan sweaters are the way to go — especially if they're as chic as this style from Old Navy. Whether you're splurging on it for yourself or giving it as a gift, it's such a timeless piece — and available in a romantic mauve color, too. amazon.comBest Pullover Sweater For WomenAnrabess Turtleneck Long-Sleeve Pullover Sweater ($30-$41) This isn't your average sweater — in fact, it's way more sophisticated. The bestselling Amazon sweater has over 4,000 near-perfect reviews on the retailer's site, and it comes in a variety of colors, too. One POPSUGAR editor bought the style herself and shared her honest opinion on the piece in this Anrabess Turtleneck Pullover Sweater review. Editor Quote: "The cozy piece currently has over 4,000 rave reviews and I had to find out why. Once it arrived I was surprised by its soft texture and good quality. I love that the silhouette is kind of like a tunic and longer in the back. It's flattering to wear jeans, sweatpants, you name it. If you're sold and need one for yourself, get shopping, because it comes in 28 fun color choices." — Krista Jones, former editor, Shoppingamazon.comBest Cable-Knit Sweater For WomenDokotoo Hollow Cable Knit Pullover Sweater ($30-$39) We'll be the first to admit that it's hard to resist a chunky, cable-knit sweater. And the loose-knit pattern on this Amazon style is extra tempting with its whimsical, woven design. The colors also range from khaki to pink, meaning you can stock up on the shade that's best suited for you (and your closet!).amazon.comBest Bouclé Sweater For WomenMerokeety Turtleneck Sweater ($30) Choose from a variety of colors of this balloon-style sweater from Amazon. With so many different variations of this piece to shop from, it's sure to be a seasonal staple in your winter wardrobe. And perhaps the most alluring prospect of the piece: that way-under-$50 price point, which feels almost unheard of for a quality boucle sweater these days.amazon.comBest Turtleneck Sweater For WomenSovelen Turtleneck Chunky Pullover Sweater ($40) Oh, to count the ways we love a good turtleneck sweater. The faux-button details on this turtleneck top are really what won us over. Plus, the style provides ample coverage on the neck, so you can feel comfortable wearing the piece out on those brisker winter days — even without a scarf. Now comes the chore of figuring out which of the 10+ colors is best.nordstrom.comBest Sweater Vest For WomenASTR the Label Pattern Turtleneck Sweater Vest ($69) Stick to the basics with this cozy sweater vest. While oversize sweater vests are proving to be super popular these days, this style boasts more of a cropped silhouette that's perfect for those looking to embrace a refined and proportional look. Layer it on top of a white button-down shirt, and you've got a new, timeless ensemble to add to your seasonal wardrobe.freepeople.comBest Half-Zip Sweater For WomenFree People Greta Half Zip Sweater ($98) When you're not quite sure whether you need a warm sweater or something more lightweight, it's best to opt for a half-zip sweater style like this version from Free People. With its zippered collar, users can easily adjust the piece to provide more or less coverage on their neck as needed — totally dependent upon outside temperatures, of course. revolve.comBest Cozy Sweater For WomenFree People Easy Street Crop Pullover Sweater ($98) Some sweaters are made to be worn and styled outside, while others are best for at-home wear — where you can snuggle and lounge around however you see fit. This cropped number from Free People definitely can do both. You can wear it on its own or style it on top of a sharp button-down top.jcrew.comBest Cashmere Sweater For WomenJ.Crew Cashmere Shrunken Crewneck Sweater ($118) If you're looking to invest in a long-lasting style that will remain a staple in your wardrobe for years to come, you really can't go wrong with a classic cashmere sweater. While there are so many different styles to shop online, we can't get enough of this plush J.Crew sweater — which even comes highly recommended by POPSUGAR editors, as detailed in this J.Crew Cropped Cashmere Sweater review. Editor Quote: "I'm a big fan of cashmere. It's so luxuriously soft, and to me, there's nothing worse than the feeling of an itchy sweater. What I don't always love is the price, and I gravitate towards J.Crew because, as someone who's tried a lot of different fabrics in my life, this cashmere is the highest quality for the best price. It's super soft and not too heavy or too light. Plus, it goes with literally everything." — India Yaffe, former associate editor, Shoppingeverlane.comBest Alpaca Sweater For WomenEverlane The Oversized Alpaca Crew ($118) We're fine with colder temperatures because they give us an excuse to wear this alpaca sweater on repeat for the rest of the year. Alpaca has a reputation for being one of the most long-lasting materials, so we appreciate that this sweater still boasts a relatively feasible price tag despite its high-quality make. The style is available to shop in a handful of fun colors. Admittedly, though, we're partial to this blush pink iteration in particular. - Additional reporting by Morgan Ashley Parker and Natasha MarshKyley Warren is an award-winning writer, editor, and affiliate strategist with more than four years of experience in the publishing space. She currently works as an assistant editor on PS Shopping and is an expert on all things related to shopping and fashion. She previously worked with Entertainment Tonight as a style commerce writer, and her byline has appeared in publications globally.Morgan Ashely Parker is a former contributor for PS Shopping.Natasha Marsh is a freelance writer who writes about fashion, beauty, and lifestyle. Prior to freelancing, she held styling staff positions at The Wall Street Journal, Burberry, Cosmopolitan, British GQ, and Harper's Bazaar.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Sweater season is one of our favorites of the entire year. While our closets are already well-stocked with chunky knits, there's never a bad time to add more styles to wear on repeat this season and well into the next. Fortunately, with so many cute sweaters for women that are already trending this year — with everything from sweater vests to cashmere pieces — there's truly no better time to start shopping.

Whether you're looking for a cropped sweater to pair with high-waisted jeans or a cable-knit sweater to dress up with cargo pants, there's something about a cozy knit that's synonymous with the season — and ideal for styling with just about any outfit. In that spirit, we made a list of all the sweaters we wish we were actually wearing right now.

So sit back, make yourself comfortable, and prepare to stock up on some seriously cozy sweaters ahead, with styles that range from a versatile sweater cardigan to a warm turtleneck. We included some of your favorite brands as well, with trendy Free People sweaters and even a handful of sweaters from Amazon that are affordable and chic.

Ahead, browse our picks for the best sweaters for women to cozy up in this fall.

Best Tunic Sweater For Women

Lane Bryant Cowlneck Stripe Tunic Sweater ($15, originally $80)

You'll be so glad to have this warm and cozy tunic sweater tucked into your wardrobe come winter. Unlike other cropped styles, this piece has a longline tunic design that provides more coverage on the body. Plus, with its classic striped pattern, you'll have no problem teaming the knit with just about any item in your closet.

Best Cardigan Sweater For Women

Old Navy Shaker-Stitch Cardigan ($27, originally $45)

When it comes to quality sweaters that you can get extended use out of in a number of different seasons, we find that cardigan sweaters are the way to go — especially if they're as chic as this style from Old Navy. Whether you're splurging on it for yourself or giving it as a gift, it's such a timeless piece — and available in a romantic mauve color, too.

Best Pullover Sweater For Women

Anrabess Turtleneck Long-Sleeve Pullover Sweater ($30-$41)

This isn't your average sweater — in fact, it's way more sophisticated. The bestselling Amazon sweater has over 4,000 near-perfect reviews on the retailer's site, and it comes in a variety of colors, too. One POPSUGAR editor bought the style herself and shared her honest opinion on the piece in this Anrabess Turtleneck Pullover Sweater review.

Editor Quote: "The cozy piece currently has over 4,000 rave reviews and I had to find out why. Once it arrived I was surprised by its soft texture and good quality. I love that the silhouette is kind of like a tunic and longer in the back. It's flattering to wear jeans, sweatpants, you name it. If you're sold and need one for yourself, get shopping, because it comes in 28 fun color choices." — Krista Jones, former editor, Shopping

Best Cable-Knit Sweater For Women

Dokotoo Hollow Cable Knit Pullover Sweater ($30-$39)

We'll be the first to admit that it's hard to resist a chunky, cable-knit sweater. And the loose-knit pattern on this Amazon style is extra tempting with its whimsical, woven design. The colors also range from khaki to pink, meaning you can stock up on the shade that's best suited for you (and your closet!).

Best Bouclé Sweater For Women

Merokeety Turtleneck Sweater ($30)

Choose from a variety of colors of this balloon-style sweater from Amazon. With so many different variations of this piece to shop from, it's sure to be a seasonal staple in your winter wardrobe. And perhaps the most alluring prospect of the piece: that way-under-$50 price point, which feels almost unheard of for a quality boucle sweater these days.

Best Turtleneck Sweater For Women

Sovelen Turtleneck Chunky Pullover Sweater ($40)

Oh, to count the ways we love a good turtleneck sweater. The faux-button details on this turtleneck top are really what won us over. Plus, the style provides ample coverage on the neck, so you can feel comfortable wearing the piece out on those brisker winter days — even without a scarf. Now comes the chore of figuring out which of the 10+ colors is best.

Best Sweater Vest For Women

ASTR the Label Pattern Turtleneck Sweater Vest ($69)

Stick to the basics with this cozy sweater vest. While oversize sweater vests are proving to be super popular these days, this style boasts more of a cropped silhouette that's perfect for those looking to embrace a refined and proportional look. Layer it on top of a white button-down shirt, and you've got a new, timeless ensemble to add to your seasonal wardrobe.

Best Half-Zip Sweater For Women

Free People Greta Half Zip Sweater ($98)

When you're not quite sure whether you need a warm sweater or something more lightweight, it's best to opt for a half-zip sweater style like this version from Free People. With its zippered collar, users can easily adjust the piece to provide more or less coverage on their neck as needed — totally dependent upon outside temperatures, of course.

Best Cozy Sweater For Women

Free People Easy Street Crop Pullover Sweater ($98)

Some sweaters are made to be worn and styled outside, while others are best for at-home wear — where you can snuggle and lounge around however you see fit. This cropped number from Free People definitely can do both. You can wear it on its own or style it on top of a sharp button-down top.

Best Cashmere Sweater For Women

J.Crew Cashmere Shrunken Crewneck Sweater ($118)

If you're looking to invest in a long-lasting style that will remain a staple in your wardrobe for years to come, you really can't go wrong with a classic cashmere sweater. While there are so many different styles to shop online, we can't get enough of this plush J.Crew sweater — which even comes highly recommended by POPSUGAR editors, as detailed in this J.Crew Cropped Cashmere Sweater review.

Editor Quote: "I'm a big fan of cashmere. It's so luxuriously soft, and to me, there's nothing worse than the feeling of an itchy sweater. What I don't always love is the price, and I gravitate towards J.Crew because, as someone who's tried a lot of different fabrics in my life, this cashmere is the highest quality for the best price. It's super soft and not too heavy or too light. Plus, it goes with literally everything." — India Yaffe, former associate editor, Shopping

Best Alpaca Sweater For Women

Everlane The Oversized Alpaca Crew ($118)

We're fine with colder temperatures because they give us an excuse to wear this alpaca sweater on repeat for the rest of the year. Alpaca has a reputation for being one of the most long-lasting materials, so we appreciate that this sweater still boasts a relatively feasible price tag despite its high-quality make. The style is available to shop in a handful of fun colors. Admittedly, though, we're partial to this blush pink iteration in particular.

- Additional reporting by Morgan Ashley Parker and Natasha Marsh

Kyley Warren is an award-winning writer, editor, and affiliate strategist with more than four years of experience in the publishing space. She currently works as an assistant editor on PS Shopping and is an expert on all things related to shopping and fashion. She previously worked with Entertainment Tonight as a style commerce writer, and her byline has appeared in publications globally.

Morgan Ashely Parker is a former contributor for PS Shopping.

Natasha Marsh is a freelance writer who writes about fashion, beauty, and lifestyle. Prior to freelancing, she held styling staff positions at The Wall Street Journal, Burberry, Cosmopolitan, British GQ, and Harper's Bazaar.
